DataElement.preferredName: AIDS Malignancy Consortium Patient Exclusion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria 045 Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial of a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment in a clinical trials cooperative group supported by NCI.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: AIDS Malignancy Consortium Patient Exclusion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial of a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment in a clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Established in 1995 to carry out Phase I and II studies of innovative therapies for AIDS malignancies.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: Established in 1995 to carry out Phase I and II studies of innovative therapies for AIDS malignancies.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: 045 Exclusion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of clinical trial eligibility exclusion criteria for an AIDS Malignancy Consortium 045 protocol.

PermissibleValues.value: Does the patient have acute, active, serious, uncontrolled opportunistic infection? (Patients with a CD4 count < 50/uL will be excluded if they have had an opportunistic infection within the past 6 months, or if there is evidence of resistance.)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Does the patient have acute, active, serious, uncontrolled opportunistic infection? (Patients with a CD4 count < 50/uL will be excluded if they have had an opportunistic infection within the past 6 months, or if there is evidence of resistance.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Does the patient have acute, active, serious, uncontrolled opportunistic infection? (Patients with a CD4 count < 50/uL will be excluded if they have had an opportunistic infection within the past 6 months, or if there is evidence of resistance.)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Does the patient have acute, active, serious, uncontrolled opportunistic infection? (Patients with a CD4 count < 50/uL will be excluded if they have had an opportunistic infection within the past 6 months, or if there is evidence of resistance.)

PermissibleValues.value: Has the patient been diagnosed with an invasive malignancy within the past 24 months? (excluding in situ cervical cancer, anal dysplasia or carcinoma in situ, non-melanoma skin carcinoma, Kaposi's sarcoma that has not required systemic chemotherapy.)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Has the patient been diagnosed with an invasive malignancy within the past 24 months? (excluding in situ cervical cancer, anal dysplasia or carcinoma in situ, non-melanoma skin carcinoma, Kaposi's sarcoma that has not required systemic chemotherapy.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Has the patient been diagnosed with an invasive malignancy within the past 24 months? (excluding in situ cervical cancer, anal dysplasia or carcinoma in situ, non-melanoma skin carcinoma, Kaposi's sarcoma that has not required systemic chemotherapy.)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Has the patient been diagnosed with an invasive malignancy within the past 24 months? (excluding in situ cervical cancer, anal dysplasia or carcinoma in situ, non-melanoma skin carcinoma, Kaposi's sarcoma that has not required systemic chemotherapy.)

PermissibleValues.value: Does the patient have Grade 2, 3, 4 neuropathy?
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Does the patient have Grade 2, 3, 4 neuropathy?

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Does the patient have Grade 2, 3, 4 neuropathy?
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Does the patient have Grade 2, 3, 4 neuropathy?

PermissibleValues.value: Does the patient have severe (grade 3 or 4) or poorly controlled diarrhea?
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Does the patient have severe (grade 3 or 4) or poorly controlled diarrhea?

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Does the patient have severe (grade 3 or 4) or poorly controlled diarrhea?
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Does the patient have severe (grade 3 or 4) or poorly controlled diarrhea?

PermissibleValues.value: If the patient is a female, is she pregnant or nursing?
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: If the patient is a female, is she pregnant or nursing?

ValueMeaning.preferredName: If the patient is a female, is she pregnant or nursing?
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: If the patient is a female, is she pregnant or nursing?

PermissibleValues.value: Does the patient have a medical or psychiatric illness that precludes ability to give informed consent or is likely to interfere with the ability to comply with the protocol stipulations?
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Does the patient have a medical or psychiatric illness that precludes ability to give informed consent or is likely to interfere with the ability to comply with the protocol stipulations?

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Does the patient have a medical or psychiatric illness that precludes ability to give informed consent or is likely to interfere with the ability to comply with the protocol stipulations?
